Derivative of a function

The derivative of a function is defined as the instantaneous rate of change of a function at a specific point.
The derivative gives the exact slope along the curve at a specific point.
In this problem we are going to evaluate the value of first derivative of a given function

Example:

consider f(x)=2x**3+2
Then derivative of f(x) is,
